metadata.title: CVE-2022-3595 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
A vulnerability was found in Linux Kernel. It has been rated asproblematic. Affected by this issue is the function sess_free_buffer of thefile fs/cifs/sess.c of the component CIFS Handler. The manipulation leadsto double free. It is recommended to apply a patch to fix this issue. Theidentifier of this vulnerability is VDB-211364.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3595` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1003.3
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-hwe: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
